author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Boeing aircraft makes emergency landing with sparks of fire in its landing gear - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Boeing aircraft makes emergency landing with sparks of fire in its landing gear Published on : Tuesday, September 29, 2015
Following a technical glitch with its hydraulics on one of its brakes, an Aer Lingus plane had to return to Kennedy Airport to make an emergency landing on Monday.
According to the reports, the Boeing 757 took off for Shannon Airport in Ireland just after 7 p.m. when it reported a hydraulic failure. The plane reportedly experienced other issues with the landing gear door and flaps as well as per the statements from the Port Authority.
While the plane returned to Kennedy Airport to make an emergency landing, it approached the runway faster than normal and due to the overheating of brakes few sparks of fire were spotted in the landing gear compartment.
The emergency responders were on spot and actively extinguished the fire before it could cause further damage. All the 110 passengers were safe disembarked from the aircraft. According to reports, they were put on next flights.
The plane was being connected to a tug to be removed, Port Authority said. Itâ€™s not clear how many passengers were on board; no injuries have been reported.
